channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12069] Finish making HFile.Writer Cell-centric; undo APIs that expect KV serializations.
item.description: See tail of parent task for discussion. Our HFile.Writer and HFile.Reader both have methods that have the client serialize Cells in the old KeyValue way. Purge these methods from these private classes.
item.summary: Finish making HFile.Writer Cell-centric; undo APIs that expect KV serializations.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Yes
HFileWriterV2/V3#append(final Cell cell) can take any form of cell either KV or non KV and serialize. This serialize the cell into KV format while write to HFile blocks.

append(final byte[] key, final byte[] value) -> Expects the key to be in KeyValue key format now.

append(final byte[] key, final byte[] value) -> Expects the key to be in KeyValue key format now.

Anoop Sam John Yeah. I'm going to remove these.

Doing it for HFile.Writer is easy.

HFile.Reader is another story altogether. For example, there is an API that returns the last key in the file – formatted as a KV 'key' – that makes it out to the StoreFile Interface (getLastKey) and is used in MR jobs. You fellas have any ideas on how to strip this stuff down other than via elbow-grease?
Should DBE be giving out Cells? But then what about stuff like midkeys and keys for the index? These would be Cells too?

Patch that does cleanup in HFile.Writer only. Removes being able to pass in append with key and value individually specified since it expects client to do the serialization... a job that DBE should be doing. Fix the parent issue test in here too though its a hack until we do HFile.Reader-side. HFile.Reader will be a different issue. It leaks the old-school KV serialization everywhere.
See what hadoopqa says.

This message is automatically generated.

Patch looks good.
Some minor comments are
nit:


+   * @param row

+   * @param value

+   * @return Cell with passed row but all other fields are arbitrary

+   */

+  public static Cell createCell(final byte [] row) {

Don't have value param for this method.

TestHFileInlineToRootChunkConversion


-      hfw.append(bytes, v);

+      hfw.append(CellUtil.createCell(bytes, v));

already this bytes is in form a KV key. May be we can avoid those steps above


  byte[] k = Bytes.toBytes(keyStr);

  System.out.println("RowKey: " + Bytes.toString(k));

  byte[] f = "f1".getBytes();

  byte[] q = "q1".getBytes();

  int keySize = (int) KeyValue.getKeyDataStructureSize(k.length, f.length, q.length);

  byte[] bytes = new byte[keySize];

  int pos = 0;

  pos = Bytes.putShort(bytes, pos, (short) (k.length & 0x0000ffff));

  pos = Bytes.putBytes(bytes, pos, k, 0, k.length);

  pos = Bytes.putByte(bytes, pos, (byte) f.length);

  pos = Bytes.putBytes(bytes, pos, f, 0, f.length);

  pos = Bytes.putBytes(bytes, pos, q, 0, q.length);

  pos = Bytes.putLong(bytes, pos, System.currentTimeMillis());

  pos = Bytes.putByte(bytes, pos, KeyValue.Type.Put.getCode());



  keys.add(bytes);

We just need the 'k' byte[] and make cell from that.

Same with TestHFileBlockIndex


byte[] k = KeyValueUtil.createFirstOnRow(row, 0, row.length, row, 0, 0,

	  row, 0, 0).getKey();



  byte[] v = TestHFileWriterV2.randomValue(rand);

  writer.append(k, v, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY);

We just need row byte[]

You or ramkrishna.s.vasudevan have thoughts on what to do about the HFile.Reader Interface and HFileScanner and how they both leak out 'keys' and 'values'... as byte arrays.

Will check abt this Stack.

Stack
You mean these things

ByteBuffer getKey();

ByteBuffer getValue();

Will discuss on this and get back on this.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan, yes sir. I figured you fellas probably have some thoughts in here. I'm game digging in but would like benefit of your thinking first.

Anoop Sam John Thank you for the detailed review.
Address Anoop Sam John comments

ByteBuffer getValue();

ByteBuffer getKey();

Yesterday could not spend time on this much. But ideally this code is not used now except in some testcases and in the getValueString and getKeyString.
Overall we have now changed the readers to work with Cell already. Where ever there is a key only thing needed we have tried to use the KeyOnlyKeyValue so that the read path uses Cell every where. Now the current work from Anoop ensures that the write path also uses Cell.
Suggest remove these methods then ?

Some of these byte-array-keys come all the way out and up into StoreFile Interface. Let me take a look at at least deprecating and shutting down access and push folks toward cell-based methods. Thanks lads.
Closing this issue after 0.99.1 release.
